intro: Tessaria ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous tessaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, Tessaria ambigua is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
